body:
> It's rare that people use container/list. Most programmers opt for just using slices instead.

There are cases where linked list is a better and more efficient choice than slices. Calling it rare is more like introducing something half-baked in the language core packages and then removing it later saying it was not well received. If my use case is not very specific where I must use certain data type, I would probably switch to something less efficient but more convenient.

> I think the combination of container/list and templates is an order of magnitude rarer.

It is not about supporting the template, it is about supporting the range iterator, template will follow that automatically (I guess).

> It doesn't seem like something worth creating a special-case for.

It's more along the lines of generalization of the iterator, not specialization.
